intro: Hieracium transiens subsp. karagoellense, commonly known as the Karagoellen hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowering heads and basal rosettes of leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to semi-arid climates. The plant's morphology reflects its ecological niche, making it a notable species in its native habitat.
